00033 #define IS_MIDICTRL_MODE(MODE)           ((MODE == DOR_MODE)   || \
00034                                           (MODE == DIOR_MODE)  || \
00035                                           (MODE == QOR_MODE)   || \
00036                                           (MODE == QIOR_MODE)  || \
00037                                           (MODE == QPI_MODE)   || \
00038                                           (MODE == SERIAL_MODE))
00039 
00040 #define IS_MIDICTRL_CMD_LENGTH(LENGTH)   ((LENGTH == MIDICTRL_CMDLENGTH_0) || \
00041                                           (LENGTH == MIDICTRL_CMDLENGTH_1) || \

00130 #define IS_MIDICTRL_CMD_VALUE(VALUE)  (VALUE <= 0xFF)
00131 #define IS_MIDICTRL_MODE_VALUE(VALUE) (VALUE <= 0xFF)

00133 /* Global functions ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00134 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00135  * @brief Enable or Disable QSPI MIDICTRL.
00136  * @param  QSPIx: where QSPIx is the selected QSPI from the QSPI peripherals.
00137  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00138  * @retval None
00139  ************************************************************************************************************/
00140 void MIDICTRL_Cmd(HT_SPI_TypeDef* QSPIx ,ControlStatus NewState)
00141 {
00142   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00143   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00144 
00145   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00146   {
00147     QSPIx->MIDICR0 |= MIDICTRL_ON;
00148   }
00149   else
00150   {
00151     QSPIx->MIDICR0 &= MIDICTRL_OFF;
00152   }
00153 }
00154 
00155 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00156  * @brief Initialize the QSPIx peripheral MIDICTRL according to the specified parameters in the MIDICTRL_InitStruct.
00157  * @param QSPIx: This parameter can be HT_QSPI.
00158  * @param MIDICTRL_InitStruct: pointer to a MIDICTRL_InitTypeDef structure that contains the configuration
00159  *        information for the specified USART peripheral.
00160  * @retval None
00161  ************************************************************************************************************/
00162 void MIDICTRL_Init(HT_SPI_TypeDef* QSPIx, MIDICTRL_InitTypeDef* MIDICTRL_InitStruct)
00163 {
00164   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00165   Assert_Param(IS_QSPI(QSPIx));
00166   Assert_Param(IS_MIDICTRL_MODE(MIDICTRL_InitStruct->MIDICTRL_MODE));
00167   Assert_Param(IS_MIDICTRL_CMD_LENGTH(MIDICTRL_InitStruct->MIDICTRL_CommandLength));
00168   Assert_Param(IS_MIDICTRL_AD_LENGTH(MIDICTRL_InitStruct->MIDICTRL_AddressLength));
00169   Assert_Param(IS_MIDICTRL_MODE_LENGTH(MIDICTRL_InitStruct->MIDICTRL_ModeLength));
00170   Assert_Param(IS_MIDICTRL_DUMMY_LENGTH(MIDICTRL_InitStruct->MIDICTRL_DummyLength));
00171   Assert_Param(IS_MIDICTRL_DATA_LENGTH(MIDICTRL_InitStruct->MIDICTRL_DataLength));
00172   Assert_Param(IS_MIDICTRL_CMD_VALUE(MIDICTRL_InitStruct->MIDICTRL_CommandValue));
00173   Assert_Param(IS_MIDICTRL_MODE_VALUE(MIDICTRL_InitStruct->MIDICTRL_ModeValue));
00174 
00175   QSPIx->MIDICR0 = (QSPIx->MIDICR0 & 0xF0800000) | MIDICTRL_InitStruct->MIDICTRL_MODE |
00176                     MIDICTRL_InitStruct->MIDICTRL_CommandLength | MIDICTRL_InitStruct->MIDICTRL_AddressLength |
00177                     MIDICTRL_InitStruct->MIDICTRL_ModeLength    | MIDICTRL_InitStruct->MIDICTRL_DummyLength   |
00178                     MIDICTRL_InitStruct->MIDICTRL_DataLength ;
00179 
00180   QSPIx->MIDICR1 = (QSPIx->MIDICR1 & 0xFFFF0000) | ((MIDICTRL_InitStruct->MIDICTRL_ModeValue) <<  MDVALUE_POS )|
00181                    ((MIDICTRL_InitStruct->MIDICTRL_CommandValue) <<  CMDVALUE_POS );
00182 }

For complete information of HT32 Series 32-bit Microcontrollers platform visit Holtek Website
